title: Server still crashes even after the commit that tried to fix it, but differently.
body:
Caused by: java.lang. RuntimeException: Cannot load class net.fab ricmc.fabric. api . client . event.lifecycle . v1 .ClientTickEvents in e nvironment type SERVER

Is the error, so I think you're still using client features even though it's the server side.
author: Brickmaster1

comments.body: oh i know what it is

title: Related to:  Constant Velocity Joints !
body:
When we go out of range (3 blocks) then the connection between joint breaks ! 

And when we come near it again it doesn't reconnects automatically, We need to break and place the joints again !

Can we make it reconnectable when they come in range ?
author: MJx9977

comments.body: im reworking joints so theyll be constrained within range instead of breaking. some of the implementation should be on the 1.18.2 branch, its really buggy though and doesnt work so dont compile it.
i really did write z += y wtf

title: Copycat wings make ship fly away on contact with ground
body:
Version info: Forge 1.20.1 version 0.0.6
with VS version 2.3.0-beta.5

I assembled a ship with a bunch of copy cat wings on it, and it just yeeted out of existence immediately.

So I assembled three copycat wings attached to three concrete blocks, and it jumped into the air and then floated back down, but kept getting faster and jumping higher until it went into the sky.

It seems like copycat flaps are much more stable when connected to heavier blocks, but if the ship is too light it will just disappear.
author: Pecant-Pie

comments.body:
The problem here is vs2. There is a jar with a version of vs2 that fixes this issue in the Tank Tussle server.

note: copycat wings weight too much but ill fix it someday
There were some merge conflicts but ive ‚Äúmerged‚Äù this
